reply.question: 1. Does the app declare the collection of data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the collection of data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that the app declares the collection of data.
reply.reference: We obtain information about you when you register or take part in events we run, or when you sign up to receive our newsletter and/or updates. The personal information we collect includes your name, email address, workplace, and telephone number. URL: https://onwellbeing.com/privacy-policy

source_documents.excerpt:
On Wellbeing is a product delivered by Aspire Software Systems Limited. Aspire Software Systems is committed to complying with General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), as interpreted by the Data Protection Act, which came into force on the 25th May 2018, and any other subsequent legislation related to this Act.
All personal information will be handled in accordance with the above to ensure that individuals are protected from misuse of personal details and that any information is handled approp...

We cannot be responsible for the privacy policies and practices of other sites even if you access them using links from our website.
In addition, if you linked to our website from a third-party site, we cannot be responsible for the privacy policies ...

reply.question: 2. If the app declares the collection of data, what type of data does it collect?

answer.full_answer: The app collects personal information such as name, email address, workplace, and telephone number.

reply.analysis: The answer is derived from the section explaining the personal information collected when individuals register or take part in events, sign up for newsletters, or updates.
reply.reference: The personal information we collect includes your name, email address, workplace, and telephone number. URL: https://onwellbeing.com/privacy-policy

reply.question: 3. Does the app declare the purpose of data collection and use?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the purpose of data collection and use.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that the personal information collected is used for specific purposes such as registering for events, receiving newsletters, and improving services. The policy also details how users can opt-out of communication.
reply.reference: This policy explains when and why we gather personal information about people who visit our website and/or use our services and how we keep it secure. We obtain information about you when you register or take part in events we run, or when you sign up to receive our newsletter and/or updates. The personal information we collect includes your name, email address, workplace, and telephone number. Your information could be used to: ... If you believe you are receiving unwanted, unsolicited emails from us, sent by us, or purporting to have been sent. URL: https://onwellbeing.com/privacy-policy

reply.question: 4. Can the user opt out of data collection or delete data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the user can opt out of data collection by unsubscribing from emails and can update or delete their data by contacting the company via email.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy states that users can unsubscribe from email communications to opt out of data collection. Additionally, users can update or request deletion of their data by contacting the company via email.
reply.reference: Each email campaign we send will offer you the opportunity to unsubscribe, you will find the unsubscribe link by scrolling to the bottom of the email and clicking ‘unsubscribe’. If you believe you are receiving unwanted, unsolicited emails from us, sent by us, or purporting to have been sent by us, please forward it with your comments to [email protected] You can update your information within any registered user account. You can also contact us if any information we hold about you is inaccurate or out of date, please email us at: [email protected] URL: https://onwellbeing.com/privacy-policy

reply.question: 5. Does the app share data with third parties?

answer.full_answer: No, the app does not share data with third parties.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that the app does not share data with third parties.
reply.reference: We recognise that your data is private and will not share your data with anyone else. URL: https://onwellbeing.com/privacy-policy
